page.title: 08Longage Farm
page.content: Mr Ridley-Day and his wife have lived at the farm for fifteen years. He has two daughters and the youngest one goes to Sibton Park Boarding School. The farm buildings are very old, some barns look very modern, but the roof and some of the walls have been rebuilt with wood and corrugated iron. One barn had the end collapse and it has been repaired by Mr Marsh from Lyminge. One barn had a combine harvester and straw in it. The house is 500 years old with Kent peg tiles on the roof. There is a Tudor barn, and a yard for dairy cows. The farm has 400 acres with 24 fields. 300 acres are arable and the other 150 acres are grass. Mr Ridley-Day produces his own hay and grows some cereals. The farm fields have all got names like Pillrags, Millfield and Blacklands.
